message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DB 

The paper deals with improving the accuracy of recommender systems by extracting semantically related search keywords from user behavior. This involves mining aggregate user search logs to discover semantic relationships between key phrases, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also mentions the use of natural language processing techniques to extract these keywords, which is a subfield of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the proposed system involves machine learning techniques to analyze user behavior and improve recommendations, which falls under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions the use of databases to store and retrieve user search logs, which falls under the category of databases (cs.DB).
